Stereo vision

Evaluation of distance based on images from two cameras

About the project

I realized the project together with three people in a course in optical metrology. The project consisted in measuring the distance to a selected object using two cameras. To achieve the project goal, two Logitech cameras were used and a Python program was written. My part in this project was related to writing the program, which on the basis of two images was able to give an approximation of the distance to the object. Finally, we assessed the accuracy of the distance indication using the device we developed and in the worst case, we got an error of 13 cm.

Measuring station

Picture of the setting of two cameras on the measuring station.

Calibration of the cameras

Calibration of the cameras in order to remove rotations and align epipolar lines.

Distance estimation

In order to measure the distance correctly I had to calculate the function of the disproportion in relation to the distance. Then I approximated this curve with a third order polynomial and used the obtained formula to calculate the distance in real time.
